content: shaping remains skip 2 chain and treble_crochet in last double_crochet turn row 32 ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet in next double_crochet bottom of garment continue in filet mesh to end of row turn ch148 and turn begin filet mesh pattern stitch over 49 mesh row 33 repeat row 31 squares continue for a total of 20 row and turn you should row 34 repeat row 32 now be at the right front edge and ready to start a right-side row 35 repeat row 31 row you will now split the work for the armholes row 36 continuing in filet mesh do 5 mesh squares right front repeat row 36 two more times fasten_off do the right front first since that is where your yarn is back row 21 continuing in filet mesh do 10 mesh squares the back is worked from the right back to the left back ending with a double_crochet skip 2 chain and treble_crochet in next double_crochet turn armhole edge with the right side facing attach your yarn to the double_crochet that is 13 squares from the left front edge materials row 21 ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet in next double_crochet yarn the wool peddler velvet viscose or any other dk weight continue in filet mesh for 21 mesh squares you should be yarn with good drape quantity two hanks 300 yards each in lime green or color of 14 mesh squares from the left front edge skip 2 chain treble_crochet in your choice i did not need nearly all 600 yards for this you next double_crochet turn may need less of a different yarn continue in filet mesh over 21 mesh squares for another 13 hook size f 3 75 mm or size needed to obtain gauge row you will now begin the back neckline shaping notions a pretty ribbon for tying it together for the right back neck row 35 right back neck continuing in filet mesh do 5 stitches and abbreviations squares skip 2 chain and treble_crochet to last double_crochet turn basic stitches and abbreviations used chain chain slipstitch continuing in filet mesh do 3 more row of 5 mesh squares single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet two together decrease patterns that repeat are fasten_off indicated by brackets for the left back neck with the right side facing attach your pattern stitch filet mesh based on a multiple of 3 stitches plus yarn to the double_crochet that is 6 squares from the left back 1 armhole edge − begin a row with ch5 counts as double_crochet ch2 skip 1st 3 stitches row 35 left back neck ch4 counts as treble_crochet skip 2 chain double_crochet the 1st double_crochet and 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet in next double_crochet continue in filet mesh to end of row 5 mesh − continue with ch2 skip 2 chains double_crochet into next double_crochet across squares turn the row until one mesh square remains continuing in filet mesh do three more row of
